oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Assessing and tackling IBK problems in dairy herds
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Angelos, John
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Moraxella bovis
Moraxella bovoculi
infectious bovine keratoconjunctivitis
IBK
pinkeye
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The purpose of this review is to provide research updates re足lated to the pathogenesis and prevention of infectious bovine keratoconjunctivitis (IBK; pinkeye), and to review commonly recognized IBK risk factors. While there has been some prog足ress made in what we know about the pathogenesis of Moraxella species commonly associated with IBK, much is still poorly un足derstood about why Moraxella spp. which can be found in eyes of normal cattle, may or may not cause clinical IBK. Unlike beef cow-calf operations, dairy management practices present both challenges and opportunities when considering IBK preven足tion. Having an understanding of IBK risk factors and applying general principles of disease control can help practitioners sort out IBK problems in dairy cattle and develop more effective IBK control plans.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; No. 59 (2025): 2025 Recent Graduate Conference Proceedings; 57-61
